page.title: 07DIALECT
page.content: In Barnsley we still use these very old words: {"Poppo"}is the Saxon word for horse. {"Gennel"}means a covered passage between 2 houses. {"Snicket"}means a cut between 2 houses. {"Laiken"}is a Viking word for playing.{"Backend"}is also a Viking word for Autumn.{"Thee"} means you. For example, "Shut up thee." {"Tha"}means you. For example, "Does tha want a feight?" ( fight ) or "Are tha laiken?" ( Are you playing out? ) {"Spice"} is our name for sweets. {"Bairn"} is a Viking word for child.{"Tig"} is another viking word for a game. It means "touch". 5 out of the 27 children in our class do not use these words even in the playground because their parents tell them not to, either because they think it is slang or they think it sounds stupid.
